sentences.english: In primitive tribes, dreams were thought to be the indication of God or the haunting of the devil.
sentences.chinese: 在原始部落中，梦被当成天神降临或是妖魔附体。

sentences.english: I want to pray to God with my utmost sincere heart and I am willing to sacrifice my life to plead God for rain.
sentences.chinese: 我要用最虔诚的心向天神祷告，愿舍身祈求上天降雨。

sentences.english: Thou to whom I dare not lift mine eyes, wilt Thou yet pardon me?
sentences.chinese: 啊，我不敢抬眼仰望的天神啊，你还肯再饶恕我吧。

sentences.english: He is thus called a disciple of the noble ones undertaking the Deva-Uposatha.
sentences.chinese: 因此他被称为修持天神布萨的圣者弟子。

sentences.english: Had dI the heavens' embroidered cloths, inwrought with golden and silver light.
sentences.chinese: 假若我有天神的绣袍，镶嵌着金光和银光。

sentences.english: I let her wear my guardian angel pin to help keep her safe.
sentences.chinese: 我让她戴上了我的保卫天神别针，来包管她的安定。

sentences.english: Are the saints going mad nowadays?
sentences.chinese: 我的天主爷爷，敢是今天的诸圣天神全疯了？

sentences.english: Finally, discuss the investigative meaning, of the " bagomal" celestial spirits offer sacrifices .
sentences.chinese: 最后，论述“宝木勒”天神祭祀研究的意义。

sentences.english: There is guarding Lion of God and lotus carved at the stone baluster of the platform.
sentences.chinese: 桃台石栏柱端刻有护天神狮及莲花。

sentences.english: A human century is equal to one day & night among the Devas of the Thirty-Three.
sentences.chinese: 人间一百年，是三十三天天神的一昼夜。

sentences.english: The young lady, a victim of the god's unwanted attention, was going to run away with her lover.
sentences.chinese: 年轻女子，为了躲避天神的垂青，决心和恋人私奔。

sentences.english: There he outshines the other devas both in beauty &in glory.
sentences.chinese: 他在彼处的美丽与荣耀胜于诸天神。

sentences.english: In this regard, cattle, sheep, hogs and dogs, or even devas lag far behind us.
sentences.chinese: 这在牛羊猪狗，甚至天神，都是不及我们。

sentences.english: These devas enjoy sense pleasures created by others for them.
sentences.chinese: 此域诸天享受着其它天神为他们创造的感官之乐。

definition: god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
